title: CNN Fallout 4: CNN uses Fallout 4 as part of Russian hacking coverage, Bethesda responds
text:
CNN Fallout 4: CNN uses Fallout 4 as part of Russian hacking coverage, Bethesda responds CNN Fallout 4: CNN uses Fallout 4 as part of Russian hacking coverage, Bethesda responds CNN USED Fallout 4 footage for a story about Russian hacking, which has left many scratching their heads and Bethesda posting a few tongue-in-cheek messages online. PUBLISHED: 05:30, Tue, Jan 3, 2017 | UPDATED: 05:55, Tue, Jan 3, 2017 BETHESDA A Fallout 4 fans spotted something a bit strange in a recent CNN report 
The news network mistakenly used footage from Bethesda’s blockbuster game to report on a breaking story coming out of the US, concerning Russian hackers. 
Footage of a Fallout 4 terminal appeared during a video which was aired late last month and was used during a segment discussing Donald Trump’s reaction to Moscow’s alleged involvement in “Significant Malicious Cyber-Enabled Activities.” 
While hacking terminals in Fallout 4 is pretty fun, it unfortunately doesn’t really resonate with the alleged goings-on in the US right now. 
First of all, the Fallout universe is without the internet, timelines diverge with ours following the Second World War, with the Fallout version of historical event never reaching the point where the internet was invented. 
The glaring error was spotted by an eagle-eyed reddit user who then posted the blunder online. CNN CNN uses Fallout 4 terminal footage 
One gamer replied: "If you want to talk about hacking on a major news network, your choices are either that or a scene from The Matrix.” 
Another added: “What about a guy wearing a hoodie and you can't see his face, he's sitting in a dark room, and you play ominous music, spooky.” 
Bethesda responded in a roundabout way to the news of CNN using Fallout 4 footage for its story, with Studio VP Pete Hines posting a tongue-in cheek response on Twitter. 
“Wait till they discover FO4 players were actually helping Russians and cracking real security through that mini game,” he tweeted. Related articles The Elder Scrolls 6 and Fallout 5: Bethesda talk 2017 update for title 
The Bethesda Games Studio account also posted a picture of the Fallout 4 terminal screen (above), along with the caption: “Sneak Peek at Season 3 of Mr Robot.” 
Bethesda have confirmed that one of Fallout 4's final major title updates will bring the game to the PS4 Pro, which already has a strong lineup. 
While no firm release date has been confirmed at this time, Bethesda have revealed that they are planning to launch Fallout 4 on Sony’s newest console next. 
That means fans could be playing a souped-up version of the game before Christmas. 
“PS4 Players can expect PS4 Pro support in our next title update for Fallout 4,” the latest message reads from the studio. 
Having been asked if the external assets limit might be removed in the future, Hines replied: “I don't know. Having it work just like other platforms was not approved. This version was.” Most read in Gaming
